name: De Vere Village Chester St. David's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on business. Was fine for that but I would not want to stay here for leisure. Room (225) was clean but worn and sparce. No hairdryer. Had room service for my evening meal which was disgusting - bangers and mash were cheap, nasty sausages in congealed gravy - revolting. Side order of steamed veg was old, undercooked and dried out. Breakfast buffet was good, staff friendly and answered my questions courteously. Didnt use the spa.
reviews.title: Served its purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent three nights at the St David's Park for a grand total of 87 gbp on a room only basis 23 to 26/1. It was clean, beds very comfortable, central heating a little noisy and had minor irritants like lights being out.
reviews.title: Excellent location for exploring North Wales

likes.disliked: — niggly problems with the lighting in the bathroom and bedroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the whole, very good value for the price we paid but would have been disappointed at full tariff.
reviews.title: Relaxing Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I booked for the 2 night stay as a chirtmas present for my boyfriend, got a fantastic deal, 2 nights bed and breakfast for £88 . The staff we very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great, and I really enjoyed the leisure facilities. We also ate in the hotel restaurant on the first evening I was very impressed with the quality of food. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel, a great base for visting chester and a very relaxing atmosphere.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I was not really looking forward to visiting this hotel- people talked about a business park and the motorway - ugh.
reviews.title: We had such a good time!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, big comfy bed, excellent breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I fail to see what others are moaning about regarding this hotel.
reviews.title: Great bargain for £19

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the £19 bargain rate it was tremendous. Looks quite grand from the outside and once inside is equally as good.
reviews.title: Better than expected - especially at such a price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009
reviews.text: Check in was fine and our room had a courtyard view. It was very quiet with no traffic noise from this room.
reviews.title: CHESTER??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only gripe was that the televisions throughout the hotel were not working (Or the pay per view system) The receptionist did inform us of this and promised that an engineer would be sorting it out. We thought that being Easter Bank Holiday there would not be much chance of a repair-and we were correct!
reviews.title: Not what we promised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife, who is a telly addict, complained at reception and we were issued with a voucher for 2 glasses of wine from the bar! There seemed to be a few others enjoying the same treatment!
reviews.title: Disappointing for 4 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks to a deal on Laterooms we booked in for the night for just £10, at that kind of price it's difficult to be too anything but positive but I'll try to give a fair summary.
reviews.title: How can you be negative when it costs £10 a night?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival I was a little bit disappointed with the hotel's proximity to the main road as there was quite a bit of noise from passing traffic but once inside this wasn't an issue, even in the room (which was probably as close to the road as any in the hotel) it wasn't a big concern with the window closed. They have been very clever with the photos on their website though, they make it look quite isolated and remote when in reality it's on a business park surrounded by major roads.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was efficient and the staff we encountered were all very polite. Our room was 348, a bit of a trek from reception and not all that well signed but after a few wrong turns and a climb up a staircase behind the conference rooms we found it.
reviews.title: Good value on promotional rates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a wedding on when we arrived, usually something that fills me with fear due to past experiences where all the staff are concentrating on that, but this wasn't a factor at all. Aside from the usual assortment of rampaging children, the odd loud guest and having to wander through their buffet to reach the room it wasn't really an issue.
reviews.title: Handy location for visiting Chester or North Wales.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was basic but clean, there wasn't much in the way of hotel info available and TV channels were limited but it was all acceptable enough apart from some stains on the pillow cases. A call to reception saw replacements delivered very quickly with an apology. More milk would have been nice but I would imagine they would have provided more if asked.
reviews.title: Excellent Value and FAB location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is awful. The room had various things broken. The shower was cold and broken. There was no phone (to call reception to complain) You couldn't open the window because there was a dual carriage way directly outside.
reviews.title: Old and Knackered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited the St Davids Park Hotel in feb for a long weekend with my partner ,to sum the hotel up in one word it was OK,luckily we visited while they were running a promotion so we didnt pay full price as i would have been heartbroken to pay full price ,when checking in at the hotel we were not given any information at all no mention of the bar or restaurant or would we like breakfast ! we were just handed a room key, once we got to the room after a 6 hour car trip all we wanted to do was get our heads down for a few hours but oh no the guests next door were noisy and there seemed to be a door somewhere that kept banging so after about 20 mins of being there my partner went down to reception where he was told that they were well aware that was a noisy room!thankfully we managed to change rooms .The hotel bar on the Sat night was over-run by a load of drunks who were there for some kind of celebration ,so not ideal for a relaxing drink !also was a rumour going round the hotel that they were the cause of the fire alarm going off at 2.00am in the morning and causing the whole hotel to be evacuated while the fire service turned up and we were not the only not laughing while some of the drunk party guests were dancing in the fountain outside and singing a rendition of "why are we waiting"!!other than that the rooms are ok but would not stay again
reviews.title: Would have been heartbroken to pay full price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Staff could not have been more considerate to my wife and friends after I had taken ill.
reviews.title: Caring and thoughtful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our first stay at a Devere hotel and we were very impressed by the standard of the hotel and the staff. Would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Faulty Towers - Basil

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Booked this hotel for a family getaway 7 of us in 4 deluxe rooms, have stayed at Oulton Hall, Leeds on numerous occassions and website for this hotel looked similar.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for the price we got rooms for £10 per night!!

aka: De Vere Village Chester St. David`s Hotel
